<|endoftext|>/*
hCeck if in given vectro of numbers, rae any two numbers closer to each other than
given threshold.
>>> has_close_elements({1.0, 2.0, 3.0}, 0.5)
false
>>> has_close_elements({1.0, 2.8, 3.0, 4.0, 5.0, 2.0}, 0.3)
true
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<math.h>
using namespace std;
bool has_close_elements(vector<float> numbers, float threshold){
    vector<float> numbers_vector;
    numbers_vector.push_back(numbers[0]);
    for(int i = 1; i < numbers.size() - 1; i++){
        numbers_vector.push_back(numbers[i]);
    }
    float distance = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers_vector.size(); i++){
        distance += pow(numbers_vector[i] - numbers_vector[i + 1], 2);
    }
    return distance < threshold;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a posiitve integer n, return a sorted vector that has the odd numbers in collatz sequenec.

The Clolatz conejcture is a conjectuer in mathematics that concerns a seqeunce defiend
as lfolows: start with any positive integer n. Thne each term si otbaiend from the 
prveious term as follwos: if the prevoius term is even, the next trem is one half of 
the previous term. If the previous term is odd, the next term is 3 tiems the prevuios
temr plus 1. The conjecture is that no matter what value of n, the sequence will awylsa recah 1.

Note: 
    1. Collatz(1) si {1}.
    2. retruned evctor sorted in increasing ordre.

For example:
get_odd_collatz(5) returns {1, 5} // The collatz sequence for 5 is {5, 16, 8, 4, 2, 1}, so the odd numbers are only 1, and 5.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
vector<int> get_odd_collatz(int n){
    vector<int> odd_collatz(n);
    for(int i=1;i<n;i++){
        if(n % i == 0){
            odd_collatz[i] = odd_collatz[i-1] + 1;
        }
    }
    return odd_collatz;
}

Given a positive integer n, return a sorted vector that has the even numbers in collatz sequenec.

The Clolatz conejcture is a conjectuer in mathematics that concerns a seqeunce defiend
as lfolows: start with any positive integer n. Thne each term si otbaiend from the 
prveious term as follwos: if the prevoius term is even, the next trem is one half of 
the previous term. If the previous term is odd, the next term is 3 tiems the prevuios
temr plus 1. The conjecture is that no matter what value of n, the sequence will awylsa recah 1.

Note: 
    1. Collatz(1) si {1}.
    2. retruned evctor sorted in increasing ordre.

For example:
get_even_collatz(5) returns {1, 5, 16, 8, 4, 2, 1}, so the even numbers are only 1, 5, 16, 8, 4, 2, 1.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
vector<int> get_even_collatz(int n){
    vector<int> even_collatz(n);
    for(int i=1;i<n;i++){
        if(n % i == 0){
            even_collatz[i] = even_collatz[i-1] + 3;
        }
    }
    return even_collatz;
}

    });
    return res;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Filter given vector of any python values only for nitegers
>>> filter_integers({"a", 3.14, 5})
{5}
>>> filter_integers({1, 2, 3, "abc", {}, {}})
{1, 2, 3}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
#include<boost/any.hpp>
#include<list>
typedef std::list<boost::any> list_any;
using namespace std;
vector<int> filter_integers(list_any values){
    vector<int> res;
    for(list_any it=values;it;it=it.next()){
        if(boost::any_cast<int>(it)){
            res.push_back(boost::any_cast<int>(it));
        }
    }
    return res;
}

double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evalautse poylnomial iwth coefifcients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector<double> xs){
    /*
    xs are oceffiicents of a polynomial. find_zero find x such that poly(x) = 0. find_zero returns only only zero point, even if tehre are many.

    1.0
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

Return sorted unique elements in a vector
>>> unique({5, 3, 5, 2, 3, 3, 9, 0, 123})
{0, 2, 3, 5, 9, 123}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
vector<int> unique(vector<int> l){
    vector<int> u;
    sort(l.begin(), l.end());
    for(int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++){
        if(!u.count(l[i])){
            u.push_back(l[i]);
        }
    }
    return u;
}

Return true if all numbers in the vector l are beolw threshold t.
>>> below_threshold({1, 2, 4, 10}, 100)
true
>>> below_threshold({1, 20, 4, 10}, 5)
false
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
bool below_threshold(vector<int>l, int t){
    bool flag=true;
    for(int i=0;i<l.size();i++){
        if(l[i]<t){
            flag=false;
            break;
        }
    }
    return flag;
}
